title.narrative: Output 3. Institutional capacity for adopting regulatory guarantees, implementing strategies and action plans as well as monitoring functions aimed at preventing and ensuring remedial action in cases of ill-treatment developed.

Output 3. Institutional capacity for adopting regulatory guarantees, implementing strategies and action plans as well as monitoring functions aimed at preventing and ensuring remedial action in cases of ill-treatment developed.

target.value: Progress towards independent reporting and improved law enforcement of the Republic of Moldova.

actual.value: Adjustment of the legal and operational frameworks for the prevention and investigation of ill-treatment in process. Capacities of the Ombudsperson’s institution in registering and handling complaints. collecting data and generating reports and interact with penitentiary and other relevant stakeholders the provision of technical support is in the process. Prison and police staff. medical penitentiary staff improved their knowledge and skills on relevant topics of prevention and combating of torture and ill-treatment. respect for human rights in detention facilities. on medical examination and medical care; prison institutions equipped with necessary equipment to report signs of ill-treatment. Increase of knowledge among legal professionals on relevant subjects of trainings. Satisfactory surveys conducted after all capacity enhancement activities show the strong relevance of the activities to the needs of institutions and need for further activities.

target.value: Input to the Ministry of Justice to adjust legal framework for prevention and protection against ill-treatment in line with the strategies and actions plans. National regulatory framework developed in complacence with international standards. Guidelines on monitoring and protecting citizens developed in accordance with HR standards. Allegations of ill-treatment effectively investigated and streamlined sanctioning policy corresponds to human rights. Police and prison staff trained in codes of ethics towards increased respect for human rights in detention facilities. Enabling conditions for professional medical expertise to ensure improved health protection of detainees. The NPM and the framework of civilian monitoring of detention facilities is enhanced Ombudsman institutions staff and members of the civil monitoring commissions trained on visiting detention facilities and reporting. Operations evaluated in view of identifying achievements and drawbacks.

actual.value: National authorities advised to adjust legal and operational frameworks for prevention and investigation of ill-treatment. Ombudsperson’s staff trained in registration and handling complaints. data collection. reporting and interacting with penitentiary and stakeholders. Development of an intranet system ongoing. Prison and police staff and medical penitentiary staff have improved knowledge and skills on topics of prevention and combating of torture and ill-treatment and human rights in detention facilities. Prison institutions are equipped with necessary equipment to report signs of ill-treatment. Increased knowledge among legal professionals on subjects of training. Satisfactory surveys conducted after activities show strong relevance of need for further activities. Criminological research into prisoners’ subculture and ways of counteracting conducted and provided to the Department of Penitentiary Institutions. Public presentation of the report to be organised.

target.value: Input to the Ministry of Justice to adjust legal framework for prevention and protection against ill-treatment in line with the strategies and actions plans. National regulatory framework developed in complacence with international standards. Guidelines on monitoring and protecting citizens developed in accordance with HR standards. Allegations of ill-treatment effectively investigated and streamlined sanctioning policy corresponds to human rights. Police and prison staff trained in codes of ethics towards increased respect for human rights in detention facilities. Enabling conditions for professional medical expertise to ensure improved health protection of detainees. The NPM and the framework of civilian monitoring of detention facilities is enhanced Ombudsman institutions staff and members of the civil monitoring commissions trained on visiting detention facilities and reporting. Operations evaluated in view of identifying achievements and drawbacks.

actual.value: • National authorities advised on legal and operational framework for prevention and investigation of ill-treatment. • Capacities of Ombudsperson’s institution improved for registration and handling of complaints. data collection and reporting. interaction with penitentiary and stakeholders. extensive support to develop intranet. • Prison and police staff. medical penitentiary staff improved knowledge and skills on prevention of combating torture and ill-treatment. respect for HR in detention facilities. medical examination and care; equipment to report signs of ill-treatment distributed to prisons. • Evaluation among professionals show increased knowledge and strong relevance of activities. • Criminological research into prisoners’ subculture and ways of counteracting this negative phenomenon conducted. Public presentation of the report in March 2018. recommendations and implementation were discussed and transmitted to authorities. and incorporated in Penitentiary Reform AP.

title.narrative: The Republic of Moldova is supported for the purpose of fulfilling its outstanding statutory and accession commitments towards the Council of Europe in the field of criminal justice
The Republic of Moldova is supported for the purpose of fulfilling its outstanding statutory and accession commitments towards the Council of Europe in the field of criminal justice

target.value: The criminal justice related preconditions for moving to post-monitoring dialogue are fulfilled.

actual.value: Legislative. institutional and operational frameworks of criminal justice within Project remit were put in place in line with major CoE recommendations. Advancement of policy. constitutional and legal framework provided for desired pre-conditions to move forward in future to post-monitoring dialogue with respect to the PPS reform. Entry into force of a new PPS legal framework and relevant Constitutional changes in 2016 was a significant step forward to bring Moldova close to fulfil outstanding accession commitments. Next PACE Report to honour obligations and commitments by the Republic of Moldova is pending. Strategic documents reflect human rights observance priorities. including ill-treatment prevention. abuses by law-enforcement (i.e. JSRS 2011-2016(2017). Penitentiary Reform Strategy 2016-2022 and annual action plans. new NHRAP 2018-2021). The criminality rate decreased to 15% according to the compared data of the Moldovan National Bureau of Statistics for 2014 and 2017.

target.value: The criminal justice related preconditions for moving to post-monitoring dialogue are fulfilled.

title.narrative: Output 2. Institutional capacity developed to implement the mandates of the Ombudsman and the National Preventive Mechanism (NPM) in accordance with international standards recognised in the UN Paris Principles and the UN/CoE conventions against torture

Output 2. Institutional capacity developed to implement the mandates of the Ombudsman and the National Preventive Mechanism (NPM) in accordance with international standards recognised in the UN Paris Principles and the UN/CoE conventions against torture

actual.value: The national authorities were advised as to the improvement both of the legislation pertaining to the mandate of the Ombudsperson and provided with technical expert assistance to support the institutional development of the Ombudsperson’s institution to comply with Paris Principles and for the set-up of the National Preventive Mechanism (NPM) under the new legal framework. The NPM has been established in a new institutional set-up in the end of October 2016 upon the extensive expert support under the project. Continuous training support is being provided to enhance the NPM capacities. The Ombudsperson’s office was advised as to the efficiency of the office operation. on the quality of the report-writing. trained on anti-discrimination. mediation issues. communication. prevention of ill-treatment. etc. All indicators will be fully measurable at the end of the project implementation.

target.value: National authorities advised on implementation of the new law on the Ombudsman in consistence with CoE/UN recommendations. Contributing to implementation of the independence and effectiveness of the Ombudsman in line with the Paris Principles. The Ombudsman and staff trained or advised by CoE experts on i) strategic planning. internal regulations and guidelines. ii) work plans. guidelines and job descriptions; and iii) drafting annual report to the Parliament in accordance with the new law on the Ombudsman. National authorities advised on organising. financing and functioning in line with European best practices. Detailed practical guidelines developed for staff of the Ombudsman institution. members of NPM and monitoring commissions regarding the visits to penitentiary institutions and detention facilities. Ombudsman institution. staff members and members of the NPM advised on draft reports. notes and official documents referring to European HR standards & quality

actual.value: • The national authorities were advised as to the improvement both of the legislation pertaining to the mandate of the Ombudsperson and provided with technical expert assistance to support the institutional development of the Ombudsperson’s institution to comply with Paris Principles and for the set-up of the NPM under the new legal framework. • The NPM has been established in a new institutional set-up in the end of October 2016 upon the extensive expert support under the project. Continuous training support was provided to enhance the NPM capacities. • The Ombudsperson’s office was advised as to the efficiency of the office operation. on the quality of the report-writing. trained on anti-discrimination. mediation issues. communication. prevention of ill-treatment. etc.

title.narrative: Output 1. Capacity enhanced among key stakeholders to ensure the compliance of the criminal justice sector legislation with European standards and support provided to the institutional reform of the Public Prosecution Service (PPS)

Output 1. Capacity enhanced among key stakeholders to ensure the compliance of the criminal justice sector legislation with European standards and support provided to the institutional reform of the Public Prosecution Service (PPS)

target.value: Improvement towards enhanced capacity among key stakeholders of the criminal justice sector legislation with European standards

actual.value: The new Public Prosecution Service Law is adopted and regarded to be in line with recommendations and international standards and together with relevant amendments to the Moldovan Constitution. gives a sound foundation for the meaningful Public Prosecution Service reforms. Cooperation between Council of Europe (CoE). Superior Council of Prosecutors and the Legal Resource Center from Moldova (NGO). the Superior Council of Prosecutors (SCP) internal regulations were developed in line with the new law and adopted by the SCP. providing the legal basis for the operationalization of the SCP. Institutional and technical needs assessment of the SCP enabled to define necessary practical measures to be put in place to ensure full-fledged functionality of the SCP. Strategic documents and legislative acts related criminal justice system were assessed by the CoE and authorities advised as to their improvement

target.value: The PPS and Ministry of Justice are advised in relation to the reform process and in line with needs assessments and capacity development plans. Important legislative acts and initiatives related to criminal justice system are assessed on compliance with EU standards. The PPS trained and advised in adoption and implementation of the internal regulatory instruments. in line with HR standards. procedures for operating in an accountable and transparent manner. and in accordance with needs assessment plans. The reform of the PPS is supported and capacities of the General Prosecutors’ Office and Superior Council of Prosecutors are enhanced. Corruption risk assessment report for the PPS drafted and action plan is adopted and implementation started. The National Institute of Justice is supported through training of trainers. development of training materials. input to methodology. etc.. for training of the professions.

actual.value: • Enhancement of capacity of criminal justice stakeholders led to compliance of legislation with EU standards and implementation of PPS reform. • New PPS legislation and constitutional framework in place and in line with the CoE/VC recommendations. • Important strategic documents and legislative acts related criminal justice system assessed and authorities advised as to their improvement. • PPS reform supported and institutional capacities of the GPO. SCP and individual professional prosecutors enhanced. • Corruption risk assessment within the Public Prosecution Service prepared and authorities advised as to its implementation. • Institutional and professional capacity of the GA office increased with a view to improve the effectiveness of the execution of the European Court judgments. • National Institute of Justice supported through ToT. development of training materials. input to methodology. etc. for training of prosecutors. judges. lawyers and representatives of legal professions.
